result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Preuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply.  Anger management evaluation and comply.  6 month review.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Richard Davis
Filed by ADA Clifford Burdon

Defendant Marcus Preuss in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM516 and 15CM606.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of 15CM606 and no contest to 15CM516.  In both cases Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 15CM516 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditons of probation include: 30 days jail, with Huber.   3 days jail credit. $443.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Anger management evaluation and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample.  In 15CM606 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: 30 days jail, with Huber, consecutive to 15CM516.  $443.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Anger management evaluation and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample. 6 month review.  Jail start 1/20/17 at 7:00 pm.  Cts. 2 & 3 Dismissed but read in.  15TR4449 dismissed.  15TR4278 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to pay $978.50 costs/fines.  8 month DL revocation.  12 month IID upon licensure.
Filed by Atty Richard Davis
plea and sentence on 12-07-2016 at 2:45 p.m.

Cases called: 15CM516 & 15CM606, Defendant Marcus Preuss in court with attorney Richard G. Davis, requested cases be set for plea and sentencing.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will hear plea today, sentencing later. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 15CM516 & Count 1 in 15CM606. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Cts. 2&3 dismissed in 15CM606. 15TR4278, defendant plead no contest, Court found guilty. Sentencing to be set.
